bibl.title: Asunexostos. IG 14. 1102. 11 (= Inscr. Graecae urbis Romae 1. 240; Iscriz. Agon. Grec. 79), IG 14. 1104. 11 (= Inscr. Graecae urbis Romae 1. 239), and Corp. Pap. Hermopol. 7. 2. 3.
bibl.note: Asclepiades' titles, aleiptos asunexostos, mean that he was not only undefeated but also that no opponent could ever throw him out of the area of competition.
bibl.seg: Poliakoff Michael Baron, Asunexostos. IG 14. 1102. 11 (= Inscr. Graecae urbis Romae 1. 240; Iscriz. Agon. Grec. 79), IG 14. 1104. 11 (= Inscr. Graecae urbis Romae 1. 239), and Corp. Pap. Hermopol. 7. 2. 3.
Asclepiades' titles, aleiptos asunexostos, mean that he was not only undefeated but also that no opponent could ever throw him out of the area of competition.
